text: Answer: 1429 Solution: The orders p and pies of the B+-tree Branch nodes will contain the SSN search key and block pointers to other nodes, so p=[B-P)/(V+P)]=[512B - 6B) / (9B+6B)] = 34. Leaf nodes will have a record pointer for each key value (because the file is not ordered on that field) plus one block pointer to the next leaf node, sopiesr= [(B-P) / (V+PR)| = [512B - 6 B) / (9B+7B)| = 31. There will be [0.69xpie] = [0.69x31] = 21 search keys per leaf node. Since the file is not ordered on that field, there will have to be a search record for each record in the file, or 30,000 of them. So, the number of leaf blocks is [30,000/21] = 1429 blocks. (The ceiling because the last block will be partially full )
